       said, "Nothing is better known than the siege of Malta."
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-96">
        <a href="#cite_note-96">
         [96]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-97">
        <a href="#cite_note-97">
         [97]
        </a>
       </sup>
       After the siege they decided to increase Malta's
       <a href="/wiki/Fortification" title="Fortification">
        fortifications
       </a>
       , particularly in the inner-harbour area, where the new city of
       <a href="/wiki/Valletta" title="Valletta">
        Valletta
       </a>
       , named in honour of Valette, was built. They also established
       <a href="/wiki/Watchtower" title="Watchtower">
        watchtowers
       </a>
       along the coasts – the
       <a href="/wiki/Wignacourt_towers" title="Wignacourt towers">
        Wignacourt
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Lascaris_towers" title="Lascaris towers">
        Lascaris
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/De_Redin_towers" title="De Redin towers">
        De Redin towers
       </a>
       – named after the Grand Masters who ordered the work. The Knights' presence on the island saw the completion of many architectural and cultural projects, including the embellishment of Città Vittoriosa (modern
       <a href="/wiki/Birgu" title="Birgu">
        Birgu
       </a>
       ), the construction of new cities including Città Rohan (modern
       <a href="/wiki/%C5%BBebbu%C4%A1" title="Żebbuġ">
        Żebbuġ
       </a>
       ) and Città Hompesch (modern
       <a href="/wiki/%C5%BBabbar" title="Żabbar">
        Żabbar
       </a>
       ) and the introduction of new academic and social resources. Approximately 11,000 people out of a population of 60,000 died of
       <a href="/wiki/Plague_(disease)" title="Plague (disease)">
        plague
       </a>
       in 1675.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-98">
        <a href="#cite_note-98">
         [98]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="French_period">
        French period
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Malta&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8" title="Edit section: French period">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article:
       <a href="/wiki/French_occupation_of_Malta" title="French occupation of Malta">
        French occupation of Malta
       </a>
      </div>
      <p>
       The Knights' reign ended when
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Napoleon_I_of_France" title="Napoleon I of France">
        Napoleon
       </a>
       captured Malta on his way to
       <a href="/wiki/Egypt" title="Egypt">
        Egypt
       </a>
       during the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/French_Revolutionary_Wars:_Campaigns_of_1798" title="French Revolutionary Wars: Campaigns of 1798">
        French Revolutionary Wars
       </a>
       in 1798. Over the years preceding Napoleon's capture of the islands, the power of the Knights had declined and the Order had become unpopular. This was around the time when the universal values of freedom and liberty were incarnated by the
       <a href="/wiki/French_Revolution" title="French Revolution">
        French Revolution
       </a>
       . People from both inside the Order and outside appealed to
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Napoleon_Bonaparte" title="Napoleon Bonaparte">
        Napoleon Bonaparte
       </a>
       to oust the Knights. Napoleon Bonaparte did not hesitate. His fleet arrived in 1798, en route to his expedition of Egypt. As a ruse towards the Knights, Napoleon asked for safe harbour to resupply his ships, and then turned his guns against his hosts once safely inside Valletta. Grand Master
       <a href="/wiki/Ferdinand_von_Hompesch_zu_Bolheim" title="Ferdinand von Hompesch zu Bolheim">
        Hompesch
       </a>
       capitulated, and Napoleon entered Malta.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-99">
        <a href="#cite_note-99">
         [99]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:152px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Napoleonbonapartemalta.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2048" data-file-width="1536" height="200" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/09/Napoleonbonapartemalta.jpg/150px-Napoleonbonapartemalta.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/09/Napoleonbonapartemalta.jpg/225px-Napoleonbonapartemalta.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/09/Napoleonbonapartemalta.jpg/300px-Napoleonbonapartemalta.jpg 2x" width="150"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Napoleonbonapartemalta.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Bust of Bonaparte at
         <a href="/wiki/Palazzo_Parisio_(Valletta)" title="Palazzo Parisio (Valletta)">
          Palazzo Parisio
         </a>
         in Valletta
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       During 12–18 June 1798, Napoleon resided at the
       <a href="/wiki/Palazzo_Parisio_(Valletta)" title="Palazzo Parisio (Valletta)">
        Palazzo Parisio
       </a>
       in Valletta.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-100">
        <a href="#cite_note-100">
         [100]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-101">
        <a href="#cite_note-101">
         [101]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-102">
        <a href="#cite_note-102">
         [102]
        </a>
       </sup>
       He reformed national administration with the creation of a Government Commission, twelve municipalities, a public finance administration, the abolition of all feudal rights and privileges, the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Abolitionism_in_France" title="Abolitionism in France">
        abolition of slavery
       </a>
       and the granting of freedom to all Turkish and Jewish slaves.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-103">
        <a href="#cite_note-103">
         [103]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-stbenedict_104-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-stbenedict-104">
         [104]
        </a>
       </sup>
       On the judicial level, a family code was framed and twelve judges were nominated.
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Public_education" title="Public education">
        Public education
       </a>
       was organised along principles laid down by Bonaparte himself, providing for primary and secondary education.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-stbenedict_104-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-stbenedict-104">
         [104]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-105">
        <a href="#cite_note-105">
         [105]
        </a>
       </sup>
       He then sailed for Egypt leaving a substantial garrison in Malta.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-106">
        <a href="#cite_note-106">
         [106]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       The French forces left behind became unpopular with the Maltese, due particularly to the French forces' hostility towards Catholicism and pillaging of local churches to fund Napoleon's war efforts. French financial and religious policies so angered the Maltese that they rebelled, forcing the French to depart. Great Britain, along with the
       <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Naples" title="Kingdom of Naples">
        Kingdom of Naples
       </a>
       and the
       <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_Sicily" title="Kingdom of Sicily">
        Kingdom of Sicily
       </a>
       , sent ammunition and aid to the Maltese and Britain also sent
       <a href="/wiki/Royal_Navy" title="Royal Navy">
        her navy
       </a>
       , which blockaded the islands.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-stbenedict_104-2">
        <a href="#cite_note-stbenedict-104">
         [104]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       General
       <a href="/wiki/Claude-Henri_Belgrand_de_Vaubois" title="Claude-Henri Belgrand de Vaubois">
        Claude-Henri Belgrand de Vaubois
       </a>
       surrendered his French forces in 1800.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-stbenedict_104-3">
        <a href="#cite_note-stbenedict-104">
         [104]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Maltese leaders presented the island to Sir
       <a href="/wiki/Alexander_Ball" title="Alexander Ball">
        Alexander Ball
       </a>
       , asking that the island become a British
       <a href="/wiki/Dominion" title="Dominion">
        Dominion
       </a>
       . The Maltese people created a Declaration of Rights in which they agreed to come "under the protection and sovereignty of the King of the free people, His Majesty the King of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland". The Declaration also stated that "his Majesty has no right to cede these Islands to any power...if he chooses to withdraw his protection, and abandon his sovereignty, the right of electing another sovereign, or of the governing of these Islands, belongs to us, the inhabitants and aborigines alone, and without control."
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-stbenedict_104-4">
        <a href="#cite_note-stbenedict-104">
         [104]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-107">
        <a href="#cite_note-107">
         [107]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="British_Empire_and_the_Second_World_War">
        British Empire and the Second World War
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Malta&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9" title="Edit section: British Empire and the Second World War">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main articles:
       <a href="/wiki/Malta_Protectorate" title="Malta Protectorate">
        Malta Protectorate
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Crown_Colony_of_Malta" title="Crown Colony of Malta">
        Crown Colony of Malta
       </a>
       , and
       <a href="/wiki/Siege_of_Malta_(World_War_II)" title="Siege of Malta (World War II)">
        Siege of Malta (World War II)
       </a>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:152px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:British_palazzo_parisio.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2052" data-file-width="1532" height="201" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c6/British_palazzo_parisio.jpg/150px-British_palazzo_parisio.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c6/British_palazzo_parisio.jpg/225px-British_palazzo_parisio.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c6/British_palazzo_parisio.jpg/300px-British_palazzo_parisio.jpg 2x" width="150"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:British_palazzo_parisio.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Plaque of the
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Rights_of_man" title="Rights of man">
          Rights of man
         </a>
         during the
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Crown_colony_of_Malta" title="Crown colony of Malta">
          British Protectorate
         </a>
         (1802) at
         <a href="/wiki/Palazzo_Parisio_(Valletta)" title="Palazzo Parisio (Valletta)">
          Palazzo Parisio
         </a>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:BombDamageMalta.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="606" data-file-width="800" height="167" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3b/BombDamageMalta.jpg/220px-BombDamageMalta.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3b/BombDamageMalta.jpg/330px-BombDamageMalta.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3b/BombDamageMalta.jpg/440px-BombDamageMalta.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:BombDamageMalta.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         The heavily bomb-damaged Kingsway (now Republic Street) in
         <a href="/wiki/Valletta" title="Valletta">
          Valletta
         </a>
         during the
         <a href="/wiki/Siege_of_Malta_(World_War_II)" title="Siege of Malta (World War II)">
          Siege of Malta
         </a>
         , 1942
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       In 1814, as part of the
       <a href="/wiki/Treaty_of_Paris_(1814)" title="Treaty of Paris (1814)">
        Treaty of Paris
       </a>
       ,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-stbenedict_104-5">
        <a href="#cite_note-stbenedict-104">
         [104]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-DIC_11_108-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-DIC_11-108">
         [108]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Malta officially became a part of the
       <a href="/wiki/British_Empire" title="British Empire">
        British Empire
       </a>
       and was used as a shipping way-station and fleet headquarters. After the
       <a href="/wiki/Suez_Canal" title="Suez Canal">
        Suez Canal
       </a>
       opened in 1869, Malta's position halfway between the
       <a href="/wiki/Strait_of_Gibraltar" title="Strait of Gibraltar">
        Strait of Gibraltar
       </a>
       and Egypt proved to be its main asset, and it was considered an important stop on the way to India, a central trade route for the British. Because of its position, several culinary and botanical products were introduced in Malta; some examples (derived from the National Book of Trade Customs found in the National Library) include wheat (for bread making) and
       <a href="/wiki/Bacon" title="Bacon">
        bacon
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">
        [
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed">
          <span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (March 2017)">
           citation needed
          </span>
         </a>
        </i>
        ]
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       Between 1915 and 1918, during the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/First_World_War" title="First World War">
        First World War
       </a>
       , Malta became known as
       <i>
        the Nurse of the Mediterranean
       </i>
       due to the large number of wounded soldiers who were accommodated in Malta.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-109">
        <a href="#cite_note-109">
         [109]
        </a>
       </sup>
       In 1919 British troops fired on a rally protesting against new taxes, killing four Maltese men. The event, known as
       <a href="/wiki/Sette_Giugno" title="Sette Giugno">
        Sette Giugno
       </a>
       (Italian for
       <i>
        7 June
       </i>
       ), is commemorated every year and is one of five National Days.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-110">
        <a href="#cite_note-110">
         [110]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-111">
        <a href="#cite_note-111">
         [111]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       Before the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Second_World_War" title="Second World War">
        Second World War
       </a>
       , Valletta was the location of the
       <a href="/wiki/Royal_Navy" title="Royal Navy">
        Royal Navy
       </a>
       's
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/British_Mediterranean_Fleet" title="British Mediterranean Fleet">
        Mediterranean Fleet
       </a>
       's headquarters. However, despite
       <a href="/wiki/Winston_Churchill" title="Winston Churchill">
        Winston Churchill
       </a>
       's objections,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-BJandCS-p36_112-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-BJandCS-p36-112">
         [112]
        </a>
       </sup>
       the command was moved to
       <a href="/wiki/Alexandria" title="Alexandria">
        Alexandria
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Egypt" title="Egypt">
        Egypt
       </a>
       , in April 1937 out of fear that it was too susceptible to air attacks from Europe.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-BJandCS-p36_112-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-BJandCS-p36-112">
         [112]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-113">
        <a href="#cite_note-113">
         [113]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ElliottP--pxx_114-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-ElliottP--pxx-114">
         [114]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       During the Second World War, Malta played an important role for the
       <a href="/wiki/Allies_of_World_War_II" title="Allies of World War II">
        Allies
       </a>
       ; being a British colony, situated close to Sicily and the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Axis_Powers" title="Axis Powers">
        Axis
       </a>
       shipping lanes, Malta was bombarded by the Italian and German air forces. Malta was used by the British to launch attacks on the Italian navy and had a submarine base. It was also used as a listening post, intercepting German radio messages including
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Enigma_(machine)" title="Enigma (machine)">
        Enigma
       </a>
       traffic.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-CP-p42-44_115-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-CP-p42-44-115">
         [115]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The bravery of the Maltese people during the second
       <a href="/wiki/Siege_of_Malta_(World_War_II)" title="Siege of Malta (World War II)">
        Siege of Malta
       </a>
       moved
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/George_VI_of_the_United_Kingdom" title="George VI of the United Kingdom">
        King George VI
       </a>
       to award the
       <a href="/wiki/Award_of_the_George_Cross_to_Malta" title="Award of the George Cross to Malta">
        George Cross
       </a>
       to Malta on a collective basis on 15 April 1942 "to bear witness to a heroism and devotion that will long be famous in history". Some historians argue that the award caused Britain to incur disproportionate losses in defending Malta, as British credibility would have suffered if Malta surrendered,
       <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Singapore" title="Battle of Singapore">
        as British forces in Singapore had done
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-116">
        <a href="#cite_note-116">
         [116]
        </a>
       </sup>
       A depiction of the George Cross now appears in the upper hoist corner of the
       <a href="/wiki/Flag_of_Malta" title="Flag of Malta">
        Flag of Malta
       </a>
       . The collective award remained unique until April 1999, when the
       <a href="/wiki/Royal_Ulster_Constabulary" title="Royal Ulster Constabulary">
        Royal Ulster Constabulary
       </a>
       became the second – and, to date, the only other – recipient of a collective George Cross.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-117">
        <a href="#cite_note-117">
         [117]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Independence_and_Republic">
        Independence and Republic
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Malta&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10" title="Edit section: Independence and Republic">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       See also:
       <a href="/wiki/State_of_Malta" title="State of Malta">
        State of Malta
       </a>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Denkmal_an_die_Unabh%C3%A4ngigkeit_Maltas_in_Valletta.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2592" data-file-width="3888" height="147" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5a/Denkmal_an_die_Unabh%C3%A4ngigkeit_Maltas_in_Valletta.jpg/220px-Denkmal_an_die_Unabh%C3%A4ngigkeit_Maltas_in_Valletta.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5a/Denkmal_an_die_Unabh%C3%A4ngigkeit_Maltas_in_Valletta.jpg/330px-Denkmal_an_die_Unabh%C3%A4ngigkeit_Maltas_in_Valletta.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5a/Denkmal_an_die_Unabh%C3%A4ngigkeit_Maltas_in_Valletta.jpg/440px-Denkmal_an_die_Unabh%C3%A4ngigkeit_Maltas_in_Valletta.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Denkmal_an_die_Unabh%C3%A4ngigkeit_Maltas_in_Valletta.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Monument to the independence of Malta in
         <a href="/wiki/Floriana" title="Floriana">
          Floriana
         </a>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Tratado_de_Lisboa_13_12_2007_(081).jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="310" data-file-width="521" height="131" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7c/Tratado_de_Lisboa_13_12_2007_%28081%29.jpg/220px-Tratado_de_Lisboa_13_12_2007_%28081%29.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7c/Tratado_de_Lisboa_13_12_2007_%28081%29.jpg/330px-Tratado_de_Lisboa_13_12_2007_%28081%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7c/Tratado_de_Lisboa_13_12_2007_%28081%29.jpg/440px-Tratado_de_Lisboa_13_12_2007_%28081%29.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Tratado_de_Lisboa_13_12_2007_(081).jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Malta joined the European Union in 2004 and signed the
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Lisbon_Treaty" title="Lisbon Treaty">
          Lisbon Treaty
         </a>
         in 2007.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       Malta achieved its independence as the
       <a href="/wiki/State_of_Malta" title="State of Malta">
        State of Malta
       </a>
       on 21 September 1964 (
       <a href="/wiki/Independence_Day_(Malta)" title="Independence Day (Malta)">
        Independence Day
       </a>
       ) after intense negotiations with the United Kingdom, led by Maltese Prime Minister
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/George_Bor%C4%A1_Olivier" title="George Borġ Olivier">
        George Borġ Olivier
       </a>
       . Under its 1964 constitution, Malta initially retained Queen
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Elizabeth_II_of_the_United_Kingdom" title="Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom">
        Elizabeth II
       </a>
       as
       <a href="/wiki/Queen_of_Malta" title="Queen of Malta">
        Queen of Malta
       </a>
       and thus
       <a href="/wiki/Head_of_state" title="Head of state">
        head of state
       </a>
       , with a
       <a href="/wiki/Governor-general" title="Governor-general">
        governor-general
       </a>
       exercising executive authority on her behalf. In 1971, the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Malta_Labour_Party" title="Malta Labour Party">
        Malta Labour Party
       </a>
       led by
       <a href="/wiki/Dom_Mintoff" title="Dom Mintoff">
        Dom Mintoff
       </a>
       won the general elections, resulting in Malta declaring itself a republic on 13 December 1974 (
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Republic_Day_(Malta)" title="Republic Day (Malta)">
        Republic Day
       </a>
       ) within the
       <a href="/wiki/Commonwealth_of_Nations" title="Commonwealth of Nations">
        Commonwealth
       </a>
       , with the
       <a href="/wiki/President_of_Malta" title="President of Malta">
        President
       </a>
       as
       <a href="/wiki/Head_of_state" title="Head of state">
        head of state
       </a>
       . A defence agreement signed soon after independence, and re-negotiated in 1972, expired on 31 March 1979.
       <sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">
        [
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed">
          <span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (March 2017)">
           citation needed
          </span>
         </a>
        </i>
        ]
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       Malta adopted a policy of
       <a href="/wiki/Neutral_country" title="Neutral country">
        neutrality
       </a>
       in 1980.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-118">
        <a href="#cite_note-118">
         [118]
        </a>
       </sup>
       In 1989, Malta was the venue of a
       <a href="/wiki/Malta_Summit" title="Malta Summit">
        summit
       </a>
       between US President
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/George_H.W._Bush" title="George H.W. Bush">
        George H.W. Bush
       </a>
       and Soviet leader
       <a href="/wiki/Mikhail_Gorbachev" title="Mikhail Gorbachev">
        Mikhail Gorbachev
       </a>
       , their first face-to-face encounter, which signalled the end of the
       <a href="/wiki/Cold_War" title="Cold War">
        Cold War
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-119">
        <a href="#cite_note-119">
         [119]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       On 16 July 1990, Malta, through its foreign minister,
       <a href="/wiki/Guido_de_Marco" title="Guido de Marco">
        Guido de Marco
       </a>
       , applied to join the European Union.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-120">
        <a href="#cite_note-120">
         [120]
        </a>
       </sup>
       After tough negotiations, a referendum was held on 8 March 2003, which resulted in a favourable vote.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-121">
        <a href="#cite_note-121">
         [121]
        </a>
       </sup>
       General Elections held on 12 April 2003, gave a clear mandate to the Prime Minister,
       <a href="/wiki/Eddie_Fenech_Adami" title="Eddie Fenech Adami">
        Eddie Fenech Adami
       </a>
       , to sign the treaty of accession to the European Union on 16 April 2003 in
       <a href="/wiki/Athens" title="Athens">
        Athens
       </a>
       , Greece.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-122">
        <a href="#cite_note-122">
         [122]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       Malta joined the
       <a href="/wiki/European_Union" title="European Union">
        European Union
       </a>
       on 1 May 2004.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-123">
        <a href="#cite_note-123">
         [123]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Following the European Council of 21–22 June 2007, Malta joined the
       <a href="/wiki/Eurozone" title="Eurozone">
        eurozone
       </a>
       on 1 January 2008.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-124">
        <a href="#cite_note-124">
         [124]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Politics">
        Politics
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Malta&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11" title="Edit section: Politics">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <table class="plainlinks metadata ambox ambox-content ambox-Refimprove" role="presentation">
       <tr>
        <td class="mbox-image">
         <div style="width:52px">
          <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Question_book-new.svg">
           <img alt="" data-file-height="399" data-file-width="512" height="39" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/99/Question_book-new.svg/50px-Question_book-new.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/99/Question_book-new.svg/75px-Question_book-new.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/99/Question_book-new.svg/100px-Question_book-new.svg.png 2x" width="50"/>
          </a>
         </div>
        </td>
        <td class="mbox-text">
         <div class="mbox-text-span">
          This section
          <b>
           needs additional citations for
           <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Verifiability" title="Wikipedia:Verifiability">
            verification
           </a>
          </b>
          .
          <span class="hide-when-compact">
           Please help
           <a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Malta&amp;action=edit">
            improve this article
           </a>
           by
           <a href="/wiki/Help:Introduction_to_referencing_with_Wiki_Markup/1" title="Help:Introduction to referencing with Wiki Markup/1">
            adding citations to reliable sources
           </a>
           . Unsourced material may be challenged and removed.
          </span>
          <small>
           <i>
            (September 2017)
           </i>
          </small>
          <small class="hide-when-compact">
           <i>

             Learn how and when to remove this template message
            </a>
            )
           </i>
          </small>
         </div>
        </td>
       </tr>
      </table>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Malta_Valletta_BW_2011-10-07_10-41-05.JPG">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2566" data-file-width="3431" height="165" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fc/Malta_Valletta_BW_2011-10-07_10-41-05.JPG/220px-Malta_Valletta_BW_2011-10-07_10-41-05.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fc/Malta_Valletta_BW_2011-10-07_10-41-05.JPG/330px-Malta_Valletta_BW_2011-10-07_10-41-05.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fc/Malta_Valletta_BW_2011-10-07_10-41-05.JPG/440px-Malta_Valletta_BW_2011-10-07_10-41-05.JPG 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Malta_Valletta_BW_2011-10-07_10-41-05.JPG" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         The
         <a href="/wiki/Courts_of_Justice_building_(Valletta)" title="Courts of Justice building (Valletta)">
          Courts of Justice building
         </a>
         in
         <a href="/wiki/Valletta" title="Valletta">
          Valletta
         </a>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main articles:
       <a href="/wiki/Politics_of_Malta" title="Politics of Malta">
        Politics of Malta
       </a>
       ,
       <a href="/wiki/Government_of_Malta" title="Government of Malta">
        Government of Malta
       </a>
       , and
       <a href="/wiki/Law_of_Malta" title="Law of Malta">
        Law of Malta
       </a>
      </div>
      <p>
       Malta is a republic
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-125">
        <a href="#cite_note-125">
         [125]
        </a>
       </sup>
       whose
       <a href="/wiki/Parliamentary_system" title="Parliamentary system">
        parliamentary system
       </a>
       and
       <a href="/wiki/Public_administration" title="Public administration">
        public administration
       </a>
       are closely modelled on the
       <a href="/wiki/Westminster_system" title="Westminster system">
        Westminster system
       </a>
       . Malta had the second-highest
       <a href="/wiki/Voter_turnout" title="Voter turnout">
        voter turnout
       </a>
       in the world (and the highest for nations without
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Mandatory_voting" title="Mandatory voting">
        mandatory voting
       </a>
       ), based on election turnout in national
       <a href="/wiki/Lower_house" title="Lower house">
        lower house
       </a>
       elections from 1960 to 1995.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-126">
        <a href="#cite_note-126">
         [126]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Unicameral" title="Unicameral">
        unicameral
       </a>
       Parliament is made up of the President and the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/House_of_Representatives_of_Malta" title="House of Representatives of Malta">
        House of Representatives
       </a>
       (Maltese:
       <i>
        Kamra tad-Deputati
       </i>
       ), which is elected by direct universal suffrage through
       <a href="/wiki/Single_transferable_vote" title="Single transferable vote">
        single transferable vote
       </a>
       every five years, unless the House is dissolved earlier by the
       <a href="/wiki/President_of_Malta" title="President of Malta">
        President
       </a>
       either on advice of the
       <a href="/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Malta" title="Prime Minister of Malta">
        Prime Minister
       </a>
       or through the adoption of a motion of no confidence carried within the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/House_of_Representatives_of_Malta" title="House of Representatives of Malta">
        House of Representatives
       </a>
       and not overturned within three days. In either of these cases, the President may alternatively choose to invite another Member of Parliament who invariably should command the majority of the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/House_of_Representatives_of_Malta" title="House of Representatives of Malta">
        House of Representatives
       </a>
       to form an alternative government for the remainder of the legislature.
      </p>
      <p>
       The House of Representatives is nominally made up of 65 members of parliament whereby 5 members of parliament are elected from each of the thirteen electoral districts. However, where a party wins an absolute majority of votes, but does not have a majority of seats, that party is given additional seats to ensure a parliamentary majority. The
       <a href="/wiki/Constitution_of_Malta" title="Constitution of Malta">
        Constitution of Malta
       </a>
       provides that the president appoint as prime minister the member of the House who is best able to command a (governing) majority in the House.
      </p>
      <p>
       The
       <a href="/wiki/President_of_Malta" title="President of Malta">
        President of Malta
       </a>
       is appointed for a five-year term by a resolution of the House of Representatives carried by a simple majority. The role of the president as head of state is largely ceremonial. The main political parties are the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Partit_Nazzjonalista" title="Partit Nazzjonalista">
        Nationalist Party
       </a>
       , which is a
       <a href="/wiki/Christian_democracy" title="Christian democracy">
        Christian democratic
       </a>
       party, and the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Partit_Laburista" title="Partit Laburista">
        Labour Party
       </a>
       , which is a
       <a href="/wiki/Social_democracy" title="Social democracy">
        social democratic
       </a>
       party. The Labour Party is currently at the helm of the government, the Prime Minister being
       <a href="/wiki/Joseph_Muscat" title="Joseph Muscat">
        Joseph Muscat
       </a>
       . The Nationalist Party and the
       <a href="/wiki/Democratic_Party_(Malta)" title="Democratic Party (Malta)">
        Democratic Party
       </a>
       , with
       <a href="/wiki/Adrian_Delia" title="Adrian Delia">
        Adrian Delia
       </a>
       as its leader, is in opposition. There are a number of smaller political parties in Malta that presently have no parliamentary representation.
      </p>
      <p>
       Until the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Second_World_War" title="Second World War">
        Second World War
       </a>
       , Maltese politics was dominated by the
       <a href="/wiki/Languages_of_Malta" title="Languages of Malta">
        language question
       </a>
       fought out by
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Italophone" title="Italophone">
        Italophone
       </a>
       and
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Anglophone" title="Anglophone">
        Anglophone
       </a>
       parties.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-127">
        <a href="#cite_note-127">
         [127]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Post-War politics dealt with constitutional questions on the relations with Britain (first with
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Maltese_integration_into_the_United_Kingdom_referendum,_1956" title="Maltese integration into the United Kingdom referendum, 1956">
        integration
       </a>
       then
       <a href="/wiki/Independence_Day_(Malta)" title="Independence Day (Malta)">
        independence
       </a>
       ) and, eventually, relations with the
       <a href="/wiki/History_of_Malta#EU_membership" title="History of Malta">
        European Union
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Administrative_divisions">
        Administrative divisions
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Malta&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12" title="Edit section: Administrative divisions">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article:
       <a href="/wiki/Local_councils_of_Malta" title="Local councils of Malta">
        Local councils of Malta
       </a>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Malta_-_administrative_division.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="600" data-file-width="800" height="165" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ed/Malta_-_administrative_division.svg/220px-Malta_-_administrative_division.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ed/Malta_-_administrative_division.svg/330px-Malta_-_administrative_division.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ed/Malta_-_administrative_division.svg/440px-Malta_-_administrative_division.svg.png 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Malta_-_administrative_division.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         <a href="/wiki/Local_councils_of_Malta" title="Local councils of Malta">
          Administrative divisions
         </a>
         of Malta
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       Malta has had a system of local government since 1993,
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-128">
        <a href="#cite_note-128">
         [128]
        </a>
       </sup>
       based on the
       <a href="/wiki/European_Charter_of_Local_Self-Government" title="European Charter of Local Self-Government">
        European Charter of Local Self-Government
       </a>
       . The country is divided into
       <a href="/wiki/Regions_of_Malta" title="Regions of Malta">
        five regions
       </a>
       , with each region having its own Regional Committee, serving as the intermediate level between local government and national government.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-129">
        <a href="#cite_note-129">
         [129]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The regions are divided into
       <a href="/wiki/Local_councils_of_Malta" title="Local councils of Malta">
        local councils
       </a>
       , of which there are currently 68 (54 in Malta and 14 in
       <a href="/wiki/Gozo" title="Gozo">
        Gozo
       </a>
       ). Sixteen "hamlets", which form part of larger councils, have their own Administrative Committee. The
       <a href="/wiki/Districts_of_Malta" title="Districts of Malta">
        six districts
       </a>
       (five on the main island) serve primarily statistical purposes.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-130">
        <a href="#cite_note-130">
         [130]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       Each council is made up of a number of councillors (from 5 to 13, depending on and relative to the population they represent). A mayor and a
       <a href="/wiki/Deputy_mayor" title="Deputy mayor">
        deputy mayor
       </a>
       are elected by and from the councillors. The executive secretary, who is appointed by the council, is the executive, administrative and financial head of the council. Councillors are elected every four years through the
       <a href="/wiki/Single_transferable_vote" title="Single transferable vote">
        single transferable vote
       </a>
       . People who are eligible to vote in the election of the Maltese
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/House_of_Representatives_of_Malta" title="House of Representatives of Malta">
        House of Representatives
       </a>
       as well as resident
       <a href="/wiki/Citizenship_of_the_European_Union" title="Citizenship of the European Union">
        citizens of the EU
       </a>
       are eligible to vote. Due to system reforms, no elections were held before 2012. Since then, elections have been held every two years for an alternating half of the councils.
      </p>
      <p>
       Local councils are responsible for the general upkeep and embellishment of the locality (including repairs to non-arterial roads), allocation of local wardens and refuse collection; they also carry out general administrative duties for the central government such as collection of government rents and funds and answer government-related public inquiries. Additionally, a number of individual towns and villages in the Republic of Malta have
       <a href="/wiki/List_of_twin_towns_and_sister_cities_in_Malta" title="List of twin towns and sister cities in Malta">
        sister cities
       </a>
       .
      </p>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Military">
        Military
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Malta&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13" title="Edit section: Military">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article:
       <a href="/wiki/Armed_Forces_of_Malta" title="Armed Forces of Malta">
        Armed Forces of Malta
       </a>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:US_Navy_111205-N-FV216-139_The_Armed_Forces_of_Malta_counter_piracy_vessel_protection_detachment_demonstrates_aerial_boarding_procedures_during_Eur.jpg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2770" data-file-width="4145" height="147" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b2/US_Navy_111205-N-FV216-139_The_Armed_Forces_of_Malta_counter_piracy_vessel_protection_detachment_demonstrates_aerial_boarding_procedures_during_Eur.jpg/220px-US_Navy_111205-N-FV216-139_The_Armed_Forces_of_Malta_counter_piracy_vessel_protection_detachment_demonstrates_aerial_boarding_procedures_during_Eur.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b2/US_Navy_111205-N-FV216-139_The_Armed_Forces_of_Malta_counter_piracy_vessel_protection_detachment_demonstrates_aerial_boarding_procedures_during_Eur.jpg/330px-US_Navy_111205-N-FV216-139_The_Armed_Forces_of_Malta_counter_piracy_vessel_protection_detachment_demonstrates_aerial_boarding_procedures_during_Eur.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b2/US_Navy_111205-N-FV216-139_The_Armed_Forces_of_Malta_counter_piracy_vessel_protection_detachment_demonstrates_aerial_boarding_procedures_during_Eur.jpg/440px-US_Navy_111205-N-FV216-139_The_Armed_Forces_of_Malta_counter_piracy_vessel_protection_detachment_demonstrates_aerial_boarding_procedures_during_Eur.jpg 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:US_Navy_111205-N-FV216-139_The_Armed_Forces_of_Malta_counter_piracy_vessel_protection_detachment_demonstrates_aerial_boarding_procedures_during_Eur.jpg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         <a href="/wiki/Protector-class_coastal_patrol_boat" title="Protector-class coastal patrol boat">
          <i>
           Protector
          </i>
          -class patrol boats
         </a>
         of the
         <a href="/wiki/Maritime_Squadron_of_the_Armed_Forces_of_Malta" title="Maritime Squadron of the Armed Forces of Malta">
          Maritime Squadron of the AFM
         </a>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       The objectives of the Armed Forces of Malta (AFM) are to maintain a military organisation with the primary aim of defending the islands' integrity according to the defence roles as set by the government in an efficient and cost-effective manner. This is achieved by emphasising the maintenance of Malta's territorial waters and airspace integrity.
       <sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">
        [
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed">
          <span title="Your explanation here (August 2015)">
           citation needed
          </span>
         </a>
        </i>
        ]
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       The AFM also engages in combating terrorism, fighting against illicit drug trafficking, conducting anti-illegal immigrant operations and patrols and anti-illegal fishing operations, operating
       <a href="/wiki/Search_and_rescue" title="Search and rescue">
        search and rescue
       </a>
       (SAR) services, and physical/electronic security/surveillance of sensitive locations. Malta's search-and-rescue area extends from east of
       <a href="/wiki/Tunisia" title="Tunisia">
        Tunisia
       </a>
       to west of
       <a href="/wiki/Crete" title="Crete">
        Crete
       </a>
       , covering an area of around 250,000 km
       <sup>
        2
       </sup>
       .
       <sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">
        [
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed">
          <span title="Your explanation here (August 2015)">
           citation needed
          </span>
         </a>
        </i>
        ]
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       As a military organisation, the AFM provides backup support to the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Malta_Police_Force" title="Malta Police Force">
        Malta Police Force
       </a>
       (MPF) and other government departments/agencies in situations as required in an organised, disciplined manner in the event of national emergencies (such as natural disasters) or internal security and bomb disposal.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-131">
        <a href="#cite_note-131">
         [131]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       On another level, the AFM establishes and/or consolidates
       <a href="/wiki/Bilateralism" title="Bilateralism">
        bilateral co-operation
       </a>
       with other countries to reach higher operational effectiveness related to AFM roles.
       <sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">
        [
        <i>
         <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed">
          <span title="Your explanation here (August 2015)">
           citation needed
          </span>
         </a>
        </i>
        ]
       </sup>
      </p>
      <h2>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Geography">
        Geography
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Malta&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14" title="Edit section: Geography">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h2>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article:
       <a href="/wiki/Geography_of_Malta" title="Geography of Malta">
        Geography of Malta
       </a>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tleft">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:General_map_of_Malta.svg">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="433" data-file-width="502" height="190" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9b/General_map_of_Malta.svg/220px-General_map_of_Malta.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9b/General_map_of_Malta.svg/330px-General_map_of_Malta.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9b/General_map_of_Malta.svg/440px-General_map_of_Malta.svg.png 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:General_map_of_Malta.svg" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Topographic map of Malta
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       Malta is an
       <a href="/wiki/Archipelago" title="Archipelago">
        archipelago
       </a>
       in the central
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Mediterranean" title="Mediterranean">
        Mediterranean
       </a>
       (in its eastern basin), some 80 km (50 mi) south of the Italian island of
       <a href="/wiki/Sicily" title="Sicily">
        Sicily
       </a>
       across the
       <a href="/wiki/Malta_Channel" title="Malta Channel">
        Malta Channel
       </a>
       . Only the three largest islands –
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Malta_Island" title="Malta Island">
        Malta
       </a>
       (Malta),
       <a href="/wiki/Gozo" title="Gozo">
        Gozo
       </a>
       (Għawdex) and
       <a href="/wiki/Comino" title="Comino">
        Comino
       </a>
       (Kemmuna) – are inhabited. The smaller islands (see below) are uninhabited. The islands of the archipelago lie on the Malta plateau, a shallow shelf formed from the high points of a
       <a href="/wiki/Land_bridge" title="Land bridge">
        land bridge
       </a>
       between Sicily and North Africa that became isolated as sea levels rose after the last
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ice_Age" title="Ice Age">
        Ice Age
       </a>
       .
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-132">
        <a href="#cite_note-132">
         [132]
        </a>
       </sup>
       The archipelago is therefore situated in the zone between the Eurasian and African tectonic plates.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-133">
        <a href="#cite_note-133">
         [133]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-134">
        <a href="#cite_note-134">
         [134]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       Numerous bays along the indented coastline of the islands provide good harbours. The landscape consists of low hills with terraced fields. The highest point in Malta is
       <a href="/wiki/Ta%27_Dmejrek" title="Ta' Dmejrek">
        Ta' Dmejrek
       </a>
       , at 253 m (830 ft), near
       <a href="/wiki/Dingli" title="Dingli">
        Dingli
       </a>
       . Although there are some small rivers at times of high rainfall, there are no permanent rivers or lakes on Malta. However, some watercourses have fresh water running all year round at
       <a href="/wiki/Ba%C4%A7rija" title="Baħrija">
        Baħrija
       </a>
       near
       <a href="/wiki/Ras_ir-Ra%C4%A7eb" title="Ras ir-Raħeb">
        Ras ir-Raħeb
       </a>
       , at l-Imtaħleb and San Martin, and at Lunzjata Valley in Gozo.
      </p>
      <p>
       <a href="/wiki/Phytogeography" title="Phytogeography">
        Phytogeographically
       </a>
       , Malta belongs to the Liguro-Tyrrhenian province of the
       <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Mediterranean_Region" title="Mediterranean Region">
        Mediterranean Region
       </a>
       within the
       <a href="/wiki/Boreal_Kingdom" title="Boreal Kingdom">
        Boreal Kingdom
       </a>
       . According to the
       <a href="/wiki/World_Wide_Fund_for_Nature" title="World Wide Fund for Nature">
        WWF
       </a>
       , the territory of Malta belongs to the
       <a href="/wiki/Ecoregion" title="Ecoregion">
        ecoregion
       </a>
       of "Mediterranean Forests, Woodlands and Scrub".
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-135">
        <a href="#cite_note-135">
         [135]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:View_of_Nature_Reserve_from_St._Agatha%27s_Tower.JPG">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2304" data-file-width="3072" height="165" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6b/View_of_Nature_Reserve_from_St._Agatha%27s_Tower.JPG/220px-View_of_Nature_Reserve_from_St._Agatha%27s_Tower.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6b/View_of_Nature_Reserve_from_St._Agatha%27s_Tower.JPG/330px-View_of_Nature_Reserve_from_St._Agatha%27s_Tower.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6b/View_of_Nature_Reserve_from_St._Agatha%27s_Tower.JPG/440px-View_of_Nature_Reserve_from_St._Agatha%27s_Tower.JPG 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:View_of_Nature_Reserve_from_St._Agatha%27s_Tower.JPG" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Maltese landscape, Għadira
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       The minor islands that form part of the archipelago are uninhabited and include:
      </p>
      <div class="div-col columns column-width" style="-moz-column-width: 30em; -webkit-column-width: 30em; column-width: 30em;">
       <ul>
        <li>
         Barbaġanni Rock (
         <a href="/wiki/Gozo" title="Gozo">
          Gozo
         </a>
         )
        </li>
        <li>
         <a href="/wiki/Cominotto" title="Cominotto">
          Cominotto
         </a>
         , (
         <i>
          Kemmunett
         </i>
         )
        </li>
        <li>
         Dellimara Island (
         <a href="/wiki/Marsaxlokk" title="Marsaxlokk">
          Marsaxlokk
         </a>
         )
        </li>
        <li>
         <a href="/wiki/Filfla" title="Filfla">
          Filfla
         </a>
         (
         <a href="/wiki/%C5%BBurrieq" title="Żurrieq">
          Żurrieq
         </a>
         )/(
         <a href="/wiki/Si%C4%A1%C4%A1iewi" title="Siġġiewi">
          Siġġiewi
         </a>
         )
        </li>
        <li>
         Fessej Rock
        </li>
        <li>
         <a href="/wiki/Fungus_Rock" title="Fungus Rock">
          Fungus Rock
         </a>
         , (
         <i>
          Il-Ġebla tal-Ġeneral
         </i>
         ) (
         <a href="/wiki/Gozo" title="Gozo">
          Gozo
         </a>
         )
        </li>
        <li>
         Għallis Rock (
         <a href="/wiki/Naxxar" title="Naxxar">
          Naxxar
         </a>
         )
        </li>
        <li>
         <a href="/wiki/%C4%A6alfa_Rock" title="Ħalfa Rock">
          Ħalfa Rock
         </a>
         (
         <a href="/wiki/Gozo" title="Gozo">
          Gozo
         </a>
         )
        </li>
        <li>
         Large Blue Lagoon Rocks (
         <a href="/wiki/Comino" title="Comino">
          Comino
         </a>
         )
        </li>
        <li>
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Islands_of_St._Paul" title="Islands of St. Paul">
          Islands of St. Paul
         </a>
         /Selmunett Island (
         <a href="/wiki/Mellie%C4%A7a" title="Mellieħa">
          Mellieħa
         </a>
         )
        </li>
        <li>
         <a href="/wiki/Manoel_Island" title="Manoel Island">
          Manoel Island
         </a>
         , which connects to the town of
         <a href="/wiki/G%C5%BCira" title="Gżira">
          Gżira
         </a>
         , on the mainland, via a bridge
        </li>
        <li>
         Mistra Rocks (
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/San_Pawl_il-Ba%C4%A7ar" title="San Pawl il-Baħar">
          San Pawl il-Baħar
         </a>
         )
        </li>
        <li>
         Taċ-Ċawl Rock (
         <a href="/wiki/Gozo" title="Gozo">
          Gozo
         </a>
         )
        </li>
        <li>
         Qawra Point/Ta' Fraben Island (
         <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/San_Pawl_il-Ba%C4%A7ar" title="San Pawl il-Baħar">
          San Pawl il-Baħar
         </a>
         )
        </li>
        <li>
         Small Blue Lagoon Rocks (
         <a href="/wiki/Comino" title="Comino">
          Comino
         </a>
         )
        </li>
        <li>
         Sala Rock (
         <a href="/wiki/%C5%BBabbar" title="Żabbar">
          Żabbar
         </a>
         )
        </li>
        <li>
         Xrobb l-Għaġin Rock (
         <a href="/wiki/Marsaxlokk" title="Marsaxlokk">
          Marsaxlokk
         </a>
         )
        </li>
        <li>
         Ta' taħt il-Mazz Rock
        </li>
       </ul>
      </div>
      <h3>
       <span class="mw-headline" id="Climate">
        Climate
       </span>
       <span class="mw-editsection">
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         [
        </span>
        <a href="/w/index.php?title=Malta&amp;action=edit&amp;section=15" title="Edit section: Climate">
         edit
        </a>
        <span class="mw-editsection-bracket">
         ]
        </span>
       </span>
      </h3>
      <div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">
       Main article:
       <a href="/wiki/Climate_of_Malta" title="Climate of Malta">
        Climate of Malta
       </a>
      </div>
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Blue_Lagoon_and_Cominotto.JPG">
         <img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1944" data-file-width="2592" height="165" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3e/Blue_Lagoon_and_Cominotto.JPG/220px-Blue_Lagoon_and_Cominotto.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3e/Blue_Lagoon_and_Cominotto.JPG/330px-Blue_Lagoon_and_Cominotto.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3e/Blue_Lagoon_and_Cominotto.JPG/440px-Blue_Lagoon_and_Cominotto.JPG 2x" width="220"/>
        </a>
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Blue_Lagoon_and_Cominotto.JPG" title="Enlarge">
          </a>
         </div>
         Blue Lagoon Bay between
         <a href="/wiki/Comino" title="Comino">
          Comino
         </a>
         and
         <a href="/wiki/Cominotto" title="Cominotto">
          Cominotto
         </a>
         island
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
      <p>
       Malta has a
       <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_climate" title="Mediterranean climate">
        Mediterranean climate
       </a>
       (
       <a href="/wiki/K%C3%B6ppen_climate_classification" title="Köppen climate classification">
        Köppen climate classification
       </a>
       <i>
        Csa
       </i>
       ),
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-cia_22-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-cia-22">
         [22]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-136">
        <a href="#cite_note-136">
         [136]
        </a>
       </sup>
       with mild winters and hot summers, hotter in the inland areas. Rain occurs mainly in autumn and winter, with summer being generally dry.
      </p>
      <p>
       The average yearly temperature is around 23 °C (73 °F) during the day and 15.5 °C (59.9 °F) at night. In the coldest month – January – the typically maximum temperature ranges from 12 to 18 °C (54 to 64 °F) during the day and minimum 6 to 12 °C (43 to 54 °F) at night. In the warmest month – August – the typically maximum temperature ranges from 28 to 34 °C (82 to 93 °F) during the day and minimum 20 to 24 °C (68 to 75 °F) at night. Amongst all capitals in the continent of Europe, Valletta – the capital of Malta has the warmest winters, with average temperatures of around 15 to 16 °C (59 to 61 °F) during the day and 9 to 10 °C (48 to 50 °F) at night in the period January–February. In March and December average temperatures are around 17 °C (63 °F) during the day and 11 °C (52 °F) at night.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Met_Office_137-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-Met_Office-137">
         [137]
        </a>
       </sup>
       Large fluctuations in temperature are rare. Snow is very rare on the island, although various snowfalls have been recorded in the last century, being the last one reported in various locations across Malta in 2014.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-138">
        <a href="#cite_note-138">
         [138]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       Average annual temperature of the sea is 20 °C (68 °F), from 15–16 °C (59–61 °F) in February to 26 °C (79 °F) in August. In the 6 months – from June to November – the average sea temperature exceeds 20 °C (68 °F).
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-weather2travel_139-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-weather2travel-139">
         [139]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-maltaweather_140-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-maltaweather-140">
         [140]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-141">
        <a href="#cite_note-141">
         [141]
        </a>
       </sup>
      </p>
      <p>
       <a href="/wiki/Sunshine_duration" title="Sunshine duration">
        Sunshine duration
       </a>
       hours total around 3,000 per year, from an average 5.2 hours of sunshine duration per day in December to an average above 12 hours in July.
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-maltaweather_140-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-maltaweather-140">
         [140]
        </a>
       </sup>
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-noaa_142-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-noaa-142">
         [142]
        </a>
       </sup>
       This is about double that of cities in the northern half of Europe, for comparison: London – 1,461;
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-London_climate_143-0">
        <a href="#cite_note-London_climate-143">
         [143]
        </a>
       </sup>
       however, in winter it has up to four times more sunshine; for comparison: in December, London has 37 hours of sunshine
       <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-London_climate_143-1">
        <a href="#cite_note-London_climate-143">
         [143]
        </a>
       </sup>
       whereas Malta has above 160.
      </p>
      <table class="wikitable collapsible" style="width:90%; text-align:center; font-size:90%; line-height: 1.2em; margin:auto;">
       <tr>
